acronyms.ABI:
Can stand for 
 - Above boundary information 
 - Advance Boundary Information
acronyms.ACARS: Aircraft communication addressing and reporting system
acronyms.ACC:
Can stand for 
 - Area Control Center 
 - Area control centre 
 - area control
acronyms.ACP:
Can stand for 
 - Accept 
 - Acceptance (message type designator)
acronyms.ACT:
Can stand for 
 - Activation 
 - Active 
 - activated 
 - activity
acronyms.ADS: The address (when used to request a repetition, the question mark (IMI) precedes the abbreviation, e.g. IMI ADS)
acronyms.AFIL: Flight plan filed in the air
acronyms.AFM: Yes or affirm or affirmative or that is correct
acronyms.AGA: Aerodromes, air routes and ground aids
acronyms.AIDC: Air traffic services interfacility data communications
acronyms.AIRMET:
Can stand for 
 - Airman's Meteorological Information 
 - Information concerning en-route weather phenomena which may affect the safety of low-level aircraft operations
acronyms.ALTN: Alternate or alternating (light alternates in colour)
acronyms.AMD: Amend or amended (used to indicate amended meteorological message; message type designator)
acronyms.ANCS: Aeronautical navigation chart — small scale (followed by name/title and scale)
acronyms.AOC: Aerodrome obstacle chart (followed by type and name/title)
acronyms.APP:
Can stand for 
 - Approach Control Service 
 - Approach control office 
 - approach control
acronyms.ARP:
Can stand for 
 - Aerodrome reference point 
 - Air-report (message type designator)
acronyms.ARTAS: Automated Radar Tracking and Control System - primary surveillance data processor
acronyms.ASHTAM: Special series NOTAM notifying, by means of a specific format, change in activity of a volcano, a volcanic eruption and/or volcanic ash cloud that is of significance to aircraft operations
acronyms.ASTERIX: All purpose Structured Eurocontrol surveillance Information exchange
acronyms.AT: At (followed by time at which weather change is forecast to occur)
acronyms.ATCSMAC: Air traffic control surveillance minimum altitude chart (followed by name/title)
acronyms.AT-VASIS: Abbreviated T visual approach slope indicator system
acronyms.BADA: Base of Aircraft Data by Eurocontrol
acronyms.BL: Blowing (followed by DU = dust, SA = sand or SN = snow)
acronyms.BRF: Short (used to indicate the type of approach desired or required)
acronyms.BUFR: Binary universal form for the representation of meteorological data
acronyms.C:
Can stand for 
 - Centre (preceded by runway designation number to identify a parallel runway) 
 - Degrees Celsius (Centigrade)
acronyms.CAT:
Can stand for 
 - Data Category 
 - Category 
 - Clear Air Turbulence
acronyms.CAVOK: Visibility, cloud and present weather better than prescribed values or conditions
acronyms.CDR:
Can stand for 
 - Call Detail Record 
 - Continuous Data Recording
acronyms.CF:
Can stand for 
 - Change frequency to 
 - Course to a fix
acronyms.CFM: Confirm or I confirm (to be used in AFS as a procedure signal)
acronyms.CLR: Clear(s) or cleared to or clearance
acronyms.CNL:
Can stand for 
 - Flight Plan Cancellation 
 - Cancel or cancelled
acronyms.COR:
Can stand for 
 - Correlation 
 - Correct or correction or corrected (used to indicate corrected meteorological message; message type designator)
acronyms.CS:
Can stand for 
 - Call sign 
 - Cirrostratus
acronyms.D:
Can stand for 
 - Downward (tendency in RVR during previous 10 minutes) 
 - Danger area (followed by identification D...)
acronyms.D-ATIS: Data link automatic terminal information service
acronyms.DCT: Direct (in relation to flight plan clearances and type of approach)
acronyms.DE: From (used to precede the call sign of the calling station) (to be used in AFS as a procedure signal)
acronyms.DEP:
Can stand for 
 - ATS departure message 
 - Depart or departure
acronyms.DR:
Can stand for 
 - Dead reckoning 
 - Low drifting (followed by DU = dust, SA = sand or SN = snow)
acronyms.DUPE: This is a duplicate message (to be used in AFS as a procedure signal)
acronyms.EEE#: Error (to be used in AFS as a procedure signal)
acronyms.EMBD: Embedded in a layer (to indicate cumulonimbus embedded in layers of other clouds)
acronyms.EXER: Exercises or exercising or to exercise
acronyms.FA: Course from a fix to an altitude
acronyms.FAT:
Can stand for 
 - Factory Acceptance Test 
 - Final Acceptance Test
acronyms.FBL: Light (used to indicate the intensity of weather phenomena, interference or static reports, e.g. FBL RA = light rain)
acronyms.FM:
Can stand for 
 - Course from a fix to manual termination (used in navigation database coding) 
 - From
acronyms.G:
Can stand for 
 - Green 
 - Variations from the mean wind speed (gusts) (followed by figures in METAR/SPECI and TAF G...)
acronyms.GA: Go ahead, resume sending (to be used in AFS as a procedure signal)
acronyms.GAGAN: GPS and geostationary earth orbit augmented navigation
acronyms.GAMET:
Can stand for 
 - Low Level Area Weather Forecast 
 - Area forecast for low-level flights
acronyms.GCA: Ground controlled approach system or ground controlled approach
acronyms.GRIB: Processed meteorological data in the form of grid point values expressed in binary form (meteorological code)
acronyms.GS:
Can stand for 
 - Ground Speed 
 - Small hail and/or snow pellets
acronyms.H: High pressure area or the centre of high pressure
acronyms.HF:
Can stand for 
 - High frequency [3 000 to 30 000 kHz] 
 - Holding/racetrack to a fix
acronyms.HO: Service available to meet operational requirements
acronyms.HS: Service available during hours of scheduled operations
acronyms.HVDF: High and very high frequency direction-finding stations (at the same location)
acronyms.HVY: Heavy (used to indicate the intensity of weather phenomena, e.g. HVY RA = heavy rain)
acronyms.HZ:
Can stand for 
 - Haze 
 - Hertz (cycle per second)
acronyms.IC: Ice crystals (very small ice crystals in suspension, also known as diamond dust)
acronyms.ICE:
Can stand for 
 - Integrated Controller Environment 
 - Icing
acronyms.IMI: Interrogation sign (question mark) (to be used in AFS as a procedure signal)
acronyms.L:
Can stand for 
 - Left (preceded by runway designation number to identify a parallel runway ...L) 
 - Locator (see LM, LO) 
 - Low pressure area or the centre of low pressure
acronyms.LCA: Local or locally or location or located
acronyms.LNG: Long (used to indicate the type of approach desired or required)
acronyms.LR: The last message received by me was (to be used in AFS as a procedure signal)
acronyms.LS: The last message sent by me was or Last message was (to be used in AFS as a procedure signal)
acronyms.M:
Can stand for 
 - Metres (preceded by figures ...M) 
 - Mach number (followed by figures M...) 
 - Minimum value of runway visual range (followed by figures in METAR/SPECI M...)
acronyms.MAC: Message for the Abrogation of Co-ordination
acronyms.MAR:
Can stand for 
 - At sea 
 - March
acronyms.MEHT: Minimum eye height over threshold (for visual approach slope indicator systems)
acronyms.METAR:
Can stand for 
 - Meteorological Aerodrome Report 
 - Aerodrome routine meteorological report (in meteorological code)
acronyms.MET REPORT: Local routine meteorological report (in abbreviated plain language)
acronyms.MHDF: Medium and high frequency direction-finding stations (at the same location)
acronyms.MHVDF: Medium, high and very high frequency direction-finding stations (at the same location)
acronyms.MIS: Missing (transmission identification) (to be used in AFS as a procedure signal)
acronyms.MOD: Moderate (used to indicate the intensity of weather phenomena, interference or static reports, e.g. MODRA = moderate rain)
acronyms.MON:
Can stand for 
 - Above mountains 
 - Monday
acronyms.MSAS: Multi-functional transport satellite (MTSAT) satellite-based augmentation system
acronyms.MSR#: Message (transmission identification) has been misrouted (to be used in AFS as a procedure signal)
acronyms.MVDF: Medium and very high frequency direction-finding stations (at the same location)
acronyms.MX: Mixed type of ice formation (white and clear)
acronyms.N:
Can stand for 
 - No distinct tendency (in RVR during previous 10 minutes) 
 - North or northern latitude
acronyms.NCD: No cloud detected (used in automated METAR/SPECI)
acronyms.NDV: No directional variations available (used in automated METAR/SPECI)
acronyms.NEG: No or negative or permission not granted or that is not correct
acronyms.NIL: None or I have nothing to send to you
acronyms.NO: No (negative) (to be used in AFS as a procedure signal)
acronyms.NOSIG: No significant change (used in trend-type landing forecasts)
acronyms.NOTAM: Notice To Airmen - A notice distributed by means of telecommunication containing information concerning the establishment, condition or change in any aeronautical facility, service, procedure or hazard, the timely knowledge of which is essential to personnel concerned with flight operations
acronyms.OCA:
Can stand for 
 - Oceanic Clearance Amendment 
 - Oceanic control area 
 - Obstacle clearance altitude
acronyms.OCL: Oceanic Clearance. Type of coordination message between TAS-KEF and FDPS.
acronyms.OGN:
Can stand for 
 - Open Glider Network 
 - Originate (to be used in AFS as a procedure signal)
acronyms.OK: We agree or It is correct (to be used in AFS as a procedure signal)
acronyms.OPA: Opaque, white type of ice formation
acronyms.OPR: Operator or operate or operative or operating or operational
acronyms.P:
Can stand for 
 - Maximum value of wind speed or runway visual range (followed by figures in METAR/SPECI and TAF) 
 - Prohibited area (followed by identification)
acronyms.PATC: Precision approach terrain chart (followed by name/title)
acronyms.PSN:
Can stand for 
 - Persisted Storage Node 
 - Position
acronyms.QD: Do you intend to ask me for a series of bearings? or I intend to ask you for a series of bearings (to be used in radiotelegraphy as a Q Code)
acronyms.QFE: Atmospheric pressure at aerodrome elevation (or at runway threshold)
acronyms.QGE: What is my distance to your station? or Your distance to my station is (distance figures and units) (to be used in radiotelegraphy as a Q Code)
acronyms.QJH: Shall I run my test tape/a test sentence? or Run your test tape/a test sentence (to be used in AFS as a Q Code)
acronyms.QNH: Atmospheric pressure adjusted to mean sea level
acronyms.QSP: Will you relay to . . . free of charge? or I will relay to . . . free of charge (to be used in AFS as a Q Code)
acronyms.QTA: Shall I cancel telegram number . . .? or Cancel telegram number . . . (to be used in AFS as a Q Code)
acronyms.QTF: Will you give me the position of my station according to the bearings taken by the D/F stations which you control? or The position of your station according to the bearings taken by the D/F stations that I control was . . . latitude . . . longitude (or other indication of position), class . . . at . . . hours (to be used in radiotelegraphy as a Q Code)
acronyms.QUJ: Will you indicate the TRUE track to reach you? or The TRUE track to reach me is . . . degrees at . . . hours (to be used in radiotelegraphy as a Q Code)
acronyms.R:
Can stand for 
 - Right (preceded by runway designation number to identify a parallel runway ...R) 
 - Rate of turn 
 - Red 
 - Restricted area (followed by identification R...) 
 - Runway (followed by figures in METAR/SPECI R...) 
 - Received (acknowledgement of receipt) (to be used in AFS as a procedure signal)
acronyms.RA:
Can stand for 
 - Rain 
 - Resolution advisory
acronyms.RAC: Rules of the air and air traffic services
acronyms.RAG:
Can stand for 
 - Ragged 
 - Runway Arresting Gear
acronyms.RE: Recent (used to qualify weather phenomena, e.g. RERA = recent rain)
acronyms.REP: Report or reporting or reporting point
acronyms.RF: Constant radius arc to a fix
acronyms.ROC:
Can stand for 
 - Request Oceanic Clearance 
 - Rate of climb
acronyms.RPT: Repeat or I repeat (to be used in AFS as a procedure signal)
acronyms.RQ: Request (to be used in AFS as a procedure signal)
acronyms.RRA: (or RRB, RRC . . . etc., in sequence) Delayed meteorological message (message type designator)
acronyms.RTD: Delayed (used to indicate delayed meteorological message; message type designator)
acronyms.RVSM: Reduced vertical separation minimum (300 m (1 000 ft)) between FL 290 and FL 410
acronyms.S:
Can stand for 
 - South or southern latitude 
 - State of the sea (followed by figures in METAR/SPECI S...)
acronyms.SAT:
Can stand for 
 - Site Acceptance Test 
 - Saturday
acronyms.SEA: Sea (used in connection with sea-surface temperature and state of the sea)
acronyms.SEV: Severe (used e.g. to qualify icing and turbulence reports)
acronyms.SH: Shower (followed by RA = rain, SN = snow, PL = ice pellets, GR = hail, GS = small hail and/or snow pellets or combinations thereof, e.g. SHRASN = showers of rain and snow)
acronyms.SIGMET:
Can stand for 
 - Significant Meteorological Information 
 - Information concerning en-route weather phenomena which may affect the safety of aircraft operations
acronyms.SMC:
Can stand for 
 - System Management Console 
 - Surface movement control
acronyms.SNOCLO: Aerodrome closed due to snow (used in METAR/SPECI)
acronyms.SNOWTAM: Special series NOTAM notifying the presence or removal of hazardous conditions due to snow, ice, slush or standing water associated with snow, slush and ice on the movement area, by means of a specific format
acronyms.SPECI:
Can stand for 
 - Special Forecast 
 - Aerodrome special meteorological report (in meteorological code)
acronyms.SPECIAL: Local special meteorological report (in abbreviated plain language)
acronyms.SRE: Surveillance radar element of precision approach radar system
acronyms.STAR:
Can stand for 
 - Standard Terminal Arrival Route 
 - Standard instrument arrival
acronyms.T:
Can stand for 
 - Temperature 
 - True (preceded by a bearing to indicate reference to True North ...T)
acronyms.TA:
Can stand for 
 - Transition Altitude 
 - Traffic advisory
acronyms.TAF:
Can stand for 
 - Terminal Aerodrome Forecast 
 - Aerodrome forecast (in meteorological code)
acronyms.TCAS RA: Traffic alert and collision avoidance system resolution advisory
acronyms.TCAS: Traffic alert and collision avoidance system
acronyms.TL: Till (followed by time by which weather change is forecast to end)
acronyms.TN: Minimum temperature (followed by figures in TAF)
acronyms.TS:
Can stand for 
 - Thunderstorm (in aerodrome reports and forecasts, TS used alone means thunder heard but no precipitation at the aerodrome) 
 - Thunderstorm (followed by RA = rain, SN = snow, PL = ice pellets, GR = hail, GS = small hail and/or snow pellets or combinations thereof, e.g. TSRASN = thunderstorm with rain and snow)
acronyms.T-VASIS: T visual approach slope indicator system
acronyms.TWR: Aerodrome control tower or aerodrome control
acronyms.TX: Maximum temperature (followed by figures in TAF)
acronyms.TXT: Text (when the abbreviation is used to request a repetition, the question mark (IMI) precedes the abbreviation, e.g. IMI TXT) (to be used in AFS as a procedure signal)
acronyms.U: Upward (tendency in RVR during previous 10 minutes)
acronyms.V: Variations from the mean wind direction (preceded and followed by figures in METAR/SPECI, e.g. 350V070)
acronyms.VA:
Can stand for 
 - Heading to an altitude 
 - Volcanic ash
acronyms.VAR:
Can stand for 
 - Magnetic variation 
 - Visual-aural radio range
acronyms.VC: Vicinity of the aerodrome (followed by FG = fog, FC = funnel cloud, SH = shower, PO = dust/sand whirls, BLDU = blowing dust, BLSA = blowing sand, BLSN = blowing snow, DS = duststorm, SS = sandstorm, TS = thunderstorm or VA = volcanic ash, e.g. VCFG = vicinity fog)
acronyms.VOLMET: Meteorological information for aircraft in flight
acronyms.VSA: By visual reference to the ground
acronyms.VV: Vertical visibility (followed by figures in METAR/SPECI and TAF)
acronyms.W:
Can stand for 
 - West 
 - Western longitude 
 - White 
 - Sea-surface temperature (followed by figures in METAR/SPECI W...)
acronyms.WAC: World Aeronautical Chart — ICAO 1:1 000 000 (followed by name/title)
acronyms.WEF: With effect from or effective from
acronyms.WIE: With immediate effect or effective immediately
acronyms.YES: Yes (affirmative) (to be used in AFS as a procedure signal)
acronyms.PEBKAC: Problem Exists Between Keyboard And Chair
acronyms.YOOYED: You're out of your element, Donny.

definitions.ADS-B: Automatic dependent surveillance - broadcast, surveillance data built on GPS reports from flights carrying appropriate equipment.
definitions.ADS-C: Automatic Dependent Surveillance - Contract, Datalink based contractual communication that supports periodic and event driven reporting from flights to ATS centres.
definitions.AFN: A communication protocol for establishing and managing Datalink connections between a flight and an ATS center.
definitions.ASTERIX: All Purpose Structured Eurocontrol Surveillance Information Exchange - standard data format for ATM information
definitions.ATZ: Aerodrome Traffic Zone. Circular zones around an airport with a radius based on the length of the runway
definitions.Adaptation: Enables persistent changes to system behaviour through adapting a defined data set, rule set, or system configuration data. These changes are made and applied by the User.
definitions.Aeronautical Data: A representation of aeronautical facts, concepts or instructions in a formalized manner suitable for communication, interpretation or processing.
definitions.Airway: "A predefined ordered set of Significant Points, that forms a commonly
definitions.Alert Trigger: A trigger that triggers an alert in the system
definitions.Ansible: An automation tool used for system wide deployment for Polaris.
definitions.Audit Event: A system event that can occur in the system that is pushed to the working position of the [Maintenance User
definitions.Background Role: This relates to a special role for assigning flights on the Pseudo Pilot application side in a Training Session. It is a role that is reserved to assume all flights that are not assumed by Pseudo Pilot roles or the Feeder role. It should be used for flights that are background traffic, i.e. never assumed to enter Student airspace, or flights that have left the Student airspace for the remainder of the exercise.
definitions.CAT: ASTERIX category numbers defining specific message types (e.g., CAT062 = System Track data)
definitions.CPDLC: Controller Pilot Datalink Communication. A communication protocol for transferring clearances and other communication between the pilot of a flight and an ATC operator through messages.
definitions.CTA: Control Area. A controlled airspace extending upwards above the earth from a specified lower limit to a specified upper limit.
definitions.CTR: Control Zone. A controlled airspace extending upwards from the surface of the earth to a specified upper limit.
definitions.Circuit: In the context of this specification, a Circuit means a set of hosts involved in e.g. a Training Session. In such a case, the hosts would be Simulator Hardware and ATM System Hardware
definitions.Cleared Route: The currently active route of a flight. At exercise start time, this is the Planned Route. It can be changed with oceanic clearance (OCL) messages and Clear flight actions.
definitions.Client: A TCP network client, connecting to Polaris ASCII Service and receiving ASCII messages (an example is MergeStrip).
definitions.Configure: The process of designing, arranging or setting-up attributes or parameters that make up the configuration of the system's or component's functions.
definitions.Datalink: A communication protocol used as the base protocol for several flight to ATS center communication solutions, e.g. AFN and CPDLC.
definitions.Distress Code: A distress code is when an aircraft sends out one of the following SSR codes from their transponder:
definitions.Dynamic: Dynamic is used within requirements to represent those system configuration changes that are required to take effect immediately without restarting or rebooting the whole or any parts of the system or component.
definitions.Error: A discrepancy between a computed, observed, or measured value or condition and the true, specified, or theoretically correct value or condition.
definitions.ETO: Estimated Time Over - The estimated time when a flight will be at the specified waypoint
definitions.Exercise Aerodrome: An aerodrome that was added to the Exercise Aerodromes list in Orion Creator. Only the Exercise Aerodromes defined for the currently running exercise can be selected when setting up a Land action for a flight.
definitions.Failure: The breakdown or inability of a component to perform its required functions within specified performance requirements.
definitions.Fast Initiation Zone: A geographical area where a configurable amount of Target Reports is needed to create a surveillance track.
definitions.Fault: A system problem such as an equipment malfunction which does not cause the total loss of a service or does not cause degradation of the quality of a service to a level unacceptable to the user.
definitions.Fault avoidance: Using techniques and procedures which aim to avoid the introduction of faults during any phase of the safety lifecycle of the safety-related system
definitions.Fault tolerance: The ability of a functional unit to continue to perform a required function in the presence of faults or errors.
definitions.Feeder Role: This relates to a special Pseudo Pilot position in a Training Session. The Feeder uses the Pseudo Pilot application to control flights that are inbound to any Student Controlled area. Another way of saying this is that the Feeder is playing the role of all coordinating centres, surrounding the Student system control area and also Piloting flights currently within control of those centres.
definitions.Fixed Point: A Fixed Point can be any of the following: a named waypoint or navaid stored in the navigational database (visible or hidden on the map); a lat/lon point with degrees only (DD(N/S)DDD(E/W)) or degrees and minutes(DDMM(N/S)DDDMM(E/W)); or a freely selected position on the geographical map.
definitions.Flight: Flight that has a filed flight plan, scheduled time and place for departure and destination.
definitions.Flight Plan Field: Refers to a field in the ICAO format flight plan
definitions.Flight Track: Flight calculated from planned flight data. The calculated track contains position, altitude, heading, and speed.
definitions.Heading: The direction in which the longitudinal axis of an aircraft is pointed, usually expressed in degrees from North (true, magnetic, compass or grid).
definitions.ILS: Instrument Landing System, is the guidance system that guides a flight to the threshold of a runway. It consists of a localizer for horizontal guidance(default is runway centre line extension) and glide path for vertical guidance(defaults to 3° descent angle). Orion Pilot currently has no way to override the default values.
definitions.Inter Facility Coordination: Coordination between the system and an adjacent ATS system.
definitions.Intra Facility Coordination: Coordination between workstations within the ATS system itself.
definitions.Internal Feeder Role: A role that will handle flights on the ATM system side in a Training Session. The user(s) assigned to this role manages flights in sectors that are not controlled by the Student(s)
definitions.Log Entry: A trace created by a system application.
definitions.MLAT: Multilateration, a surveillance source that is built upon calculating a target position from time-stamp comparison from ADS-B or radar ground station messages.
definitions.Median: Middle value when measurements are sorted (P50)
definitions.Mono Track:
Track calculated from single surveillance source, where surveillance source type can be one of the following types:
 -SSR 
 -ADS-B 
 -MLAT
definitions.Multi Track: Track calculated from combined information gathered multiple surveillance sources, where surveillance source type can be one of the following types:
definitions.NATs: North Atlantic Tracks, structured set of airways over the Atlantic Ocean.
definitions.NG-AIME: New Generation Aeronautical Information Management Environment) is a unique platform for digitizing aeronautical data, allowing users to manage safety-critical data and optimize processes. NG-AIME products are based on the AIXM 5.1 format, which is recommended by the European Organization for the Safety of Air Navigation (Eurocontrol), and the Federal Aviation Administration (FAA). Digital information with time and geographical representation brings the actual situation to the systems and users, e.g., closed runways and taxiways, work in progress areas, temporary routes, etc.
definitions.NetRRR: Network Record, Replay, Review system for ATM data recording and playback
definitions.OMNI SID: In cases where no track guidance is provided, departure procedures are designed using the omnidirectional method. The omnidirectional departure normally allows departure in any direction.
definitions.Observium: an auto-discovering network monitoring platform supporting a wide range of hardware platforms and operating systems including Cisco, Windows, Linux, HP, Juniper, Dell, FreeBSD, F5, Brocade, Citrix Netscaler, NetApp and many more. Observium seeks to provide a powerful yet simple and intuitive interface to the health and status of your network
definitions.Orion Creator: The application in the Orion suite in which exercises are created.
definitions.Orion Pilot: The application in the Orion suite in which exercises are run.
definitions.Planned Level: The altitude or flight-level that a pilot or an airline sets in a flight-plan when scheduling a flight.
definitions.Planned Route: The route that was stored for a given flight during exercise creation. This corresponds to the route (field 15) in a flight plan (FPL) message. sets in a flight-plan when scheduling a flight.
definitions.Planned Speed: The true airspeed or mach speed that a pilot or an airline sets in a flight-plan when scheduling a flight.
definitions.Position Point: A geographical point used in e.g. Planned Routes it has a name that defines a latitude/longitude position. It usually has the format DDMM(N/S)DDDMM(W/E) e.g. 6430N02105W, or DD(N/S)DDD(W/E) e.g. 64N021W.
definitions.Primary Track: A Track calculated from consecutive radar observation of the same target using a Primary Surveillance Radar (PSR).
definitions.Pseudo Pilot Role: This relates to the main Pseudo Pilot position(s) in a Training Session. Pseudo Pilot roles always listen to a given Student on the Students' VHF frequency. Flights are assumed by a Pseudo Pilot role while they are under control of the corresponding student.
definitions.RSS: Resident Set Size: Physical memory (RAM) actively used by the process, measured in megabytes. This is the primary metric for capacity planning as it represents actual physical memory consumption.
definitions.Radio Centre: Defined here as an external communications facility that serves as a middle man in ATC communication, communicating through messaging with an ATS provider on one end and through radio with the pilots on the other end. Orion Pilot can simulate the message handling for Radio Centres.
definitions.ROC: Request Oceanic Clearance. Type of coordination message between TAS-KEF and FDPS.
definitions.SNMP trap: A message sent from an SNMP agent to an SNMP manager acting as an immediate alert mechanism.
definitions.SNMP walk: Simple Network Management Protocol (SNMP) used to monitor a device.
definitions.Savitzky-Golay Filter: Data smoothing technique that uses polynomial fitting over a sliding window to reduce measurement noise while preserving signal features. Applied to time series visualizations to improve readability without affecting statistical calculations.
definitions.Significant Point: A named waypoint with a defined position. Can be used in e.g. Planned Routes, Cleared Routes and clearance conditions.
definitions.Strip Field: A Field in an electronic strip as seen in Figure Electronic Strip fields
definitions.Surveillance Track: A Track calculated from consecutive radar observation of the same target. Surveillance Tracks have at minimum calculated position, direction (magnetic and true) and speed. Surveillance track can be a Multi-Track or a Mono-Track.
definitions.Syslog: A protocol used for sending system messages to a log server.
definitions.SFR: System Flight Record - Refers to data object in the system for a particular Flight. The System Flight Record contains all information about the flight (it is sometimes referred to as the Flight Data Record)
definitions.System Track: Processed and correlated aircraft track from ARTAS
definitions.TCA: Terminal Control Area. A control area normally established at the confluence of ATS Routes in the vicinity of one or more major aerodromes.
definitions.TMA: Terminal Manoeuvring Area. A designated area of controlled airspace surrounding a major airport where there is a high volume of traffic.
definitions.Target: The identified object observed by a single observation from a radar source.
definitions.Thread: Independent execution unit within the application, allowing parallel processing
definitions.Track: The projection on the earth's surface of the path of an aircraft, the direction of which path at any point is usually expressed in degrees from North (true, magnetic or grid).
definitions.VSZ: Virtual Set Size - Total virtual memory address space reserved by the process, including memory not yet physically loaded, shared libraries, and memory-mapped files. Often significantly larger than RSS. Due to virtual memory overcommitment on modern systems, VSZ values can be misleadingly large and are less useful for capacity planning than RSS. VSZ is primarily useful for detecting address space exhaustion on 32-bit systems.
definitions.Wind vane, wind rose: A compass-like instrument that shows wind direction and speed.
definitions.pidstat: Linux performance monitoring tool that reports process and thread-level CPU usage over time intervals (provides instantaneous measurements rather than cumulative averages)
definitions.polaris-asd: Graphical user interface application by Tern Systems. It is designed for Air Traffic Controllers for effective airspace traffic display and control
definitions.Aeronautical Editor: The Aeronautical Editor allows editing of aeronautical data and publishing the resulting configuration to the System Management Console (SMC). The application provides an interface to edit, create or delete aeronautical data in a user-friendly manner.
definitions.Nexus UI: The Nexus UI is designed to provide air traffic controllers and ATM personnel with a clear and efficient way to access operational data and tools.
definitions.Aries:
The Aries product suite currently consists of two systems. 
  - Aries Weather is a data display for airport personnel. Aries collects the data of several airport weather sensors, and calculates derived values, before displaying it.
  - Aries Lighting records and displays the state of airport equipment, and provides a control interface.
definitions.ISDS: Integrated Situation Display System. It is a single application that combines the functionality of a radar data display, as the RWS Target Presentation Manager (TPM), and a situation display, as the Situation Display Workstation (SDW). Therefore, air traffic controllers will have access and overview of all aircraft in the Icelandic control area in one view.
definitions.ICE: ICE (Integrated Controller Environment) system is a comprehensive air traffic management platform that runs as a distributed set of services in the ISAVIA ANS operational environment. ICE receives flight plan data from FDPS, processes surveillance data from ARTAS, and provides correlation services to external clients such as ISDS.
definitions.CDR:
CDR provides the following services: 
 - Surveillance Data Recording:
   - Records Multicasts from external surveillance sources to files.
   - Records Multicast from the Multi Sensor Tracker to files.
   - Records Multicast from Sensor Status Monitor to files.
 - Safety Net Server Recordings:
   - Records Multicast from the Safety Net Server to files.
 - Flight and Weather data related recordings:
   - Stores received and sent AFTN messages in a database.
   - Stores received and sent FMPT messages in a database.
   - Flight plan tracks multicast from FDP.
   - Records internal flows of data between subsystems for troubleshooting purposes.
 - Playback of external surveillance sources and external flight data.
 - Playback of Safety Net Server recordings.
 - Playback of flight and weather data related recordings.
 - Storage of syslog events.

File management to remove recordings older than a configurable count of days, or hours.
definitions.EDS: The Environmental Data Service (EDS) function is intended to provide access to runtime environmental data, as well as allowing for operations on it. The environmental data is stored in the Persisted Storage Node (PSN). Several disparate data-sets are maintained including dynamic safety net data, dynamic sectorisation data, operational mode, runway in use and NOTAM messages.
definitions.FDP: The purpose of the FDP backend system is to provide integration of flight data and flight progress information from various sources, as well as to provide communications with adjacent centers and external entities.
definitions.SNS: SNS monitors the targets in the airspace and provides alerts when hazardous situations are possible.
definitions.WDS: The Weather Message Publish Service manages the states of weather messages by processing incoming weather messages and by storing the processed data onto PSN. It also provides an interface for other applications to subscribe to in order to receive and update weather messages.
definitions.WSS: The Workstation Service (WSS) provides access to runtime workstation data, as well as allowing for operations on it. The workstation data is stored in the Persisted Storage Node (PSN).
definitions.SDPS: The SDP subsystem provides surveillance data processing for data received from connected surveillance sensors.
definitions.SMC: The System Management Console (SMC) is the main tool for monitoring and managing the Polaris system. The following chapters describe how to manage the operation of the system using the SMC user interface.
definitions.Tatoo: tatoo is a python library for creating input and reading output for/from ATS related software.
definitions.RAG: Runway Arresting Gear - It is installed on the runway for the purpose of safely arresting an aircraft in the event of an aborted takeoff or an emergency landing.
definitions.PBL: Polaris Backend Library - Contains common libraries used by all polaris end applications, both UI and backend services.
